required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Translational Study Investigating Predictors of Outcome in Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Patients Treated With Nivolumab (I-Rene Trial)
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Translational Study Investigating Predictors of Outcome in Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Patients Treated With Nivolumab (I-Rene Trial)

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione IRCCS Istituto Nazionale dei Tumori, Milano

clinical_study.source: Fondazione IRCCS Istituto Nazionale dei Tumori, Milano

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective translational study investigating predictors of outcome in metastatic renal cell carcinoma patients treated with Nivolumab (I-Rene trial)

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective translational study investigating predictors of outcome in metastatic renal cell carcinoma patients treated with Nivolumab (I-Rene trial)

primary_outcome.measure: Investigate the predictive role of circulating miRNAs will be studied with OpenArray technology (OA, Thermo Fisher)
primary_outcome.description: To investigate the predictive role of circulating miRNAs in patients who respond to nivolumab versus those who do not respond before treatment, after two infusions (4 weeks), at the first radiological re-evaluation (12 weeks) and at the time of disease progression.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate whether the immunological profile of tumor tissue or circulating tumor cells Using Multiplexed Biomarker Imaging (MBI), multiparametric flow cytometry
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate whether the immunological profile of tumor tissue or circulating tumor cells may be a potential predictor of clinical response in patients treated with nivolumab. Using Multiplexed Biomarker Imaging (MBI), multiparametric flow cytometry

primary_outcome.measure: Characterize alterations in genes and signal transmission pathways. Using Next Generation Sequencing, NGS)
primary_outcome.description: o characterize alterations in genes and signaling pathways and to identify mutational burden differences between tumors of patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma who respond or not to nivolumab.

arm_group.description: Patients candidates for II line therapy with Nivolumab from clinical practice
Patients candidates for II line therapy with TKI from clinical practice

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent
- metastatic renal cell carcinoma (a clear-cell/ not clear-cell)
- Progression to previous treatment with tyrosine kinase inhibitors
- Patients candidates for II-line therapy with Nivolumab (or tyrosine kinase inhibitors-in the control arm)
Exclusion Criteria:
none

overall_official.affiliation: Fondazione IRCCS Istituto Nazionale Tumori Milano
